He has a built-in advantage, but it's a big state and it requires many days on the road to campaign successfully, he said. Jim Bopp, a Terre Haute attorney who also is a Republican National Committee member, said Mike Pence could be hard to beat if he runs for governor.

and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan. 28.

inaugural, National Review Online spoke with Mike Pence about the Gipper, asking what his legacy means to him and the GOP. " Ronald Reagan is the reason I'm a Republican," Mike Pence tells us. I was active in local Democratic politics when I was a teenager in Columbus, Indiana. Then I started to hear the voice of a B-movie actor, turned governor, turned candidate. He gave voice to the ideals and values that I was raised to believe in. Republicans, Mike Pence continues, should learn from how Ronald Reagan led. We are at the point where, between the geolocation capability of the phone and the power of the phone's browser platform, it is possible to deliver personalized information about where you are, what you could do there right now, and so forth-- and to deliver such a service at scale, Eric Schmidt wrote. It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the( judging) room saying, " Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn"t work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler .
